examples: They drove a tunnel through the solid rock.
If you're planning to start a business, it's important to have a solid business plan and some experience in the industry.
The chemical passes from a liquid to a solid state during the cooling process.
Joe warned him that 'a fool's bolt is soon shot' and advised him to take the time to develop a solid plan before making any drastic decisions.
The project's success will rely on getting the meat and potatoes right, ensuring the core components are solid.
words.defineEn: (geometry) a shape that is not two-dimensional because it has height, width, and length
words.defineVi: (hình học) một hình không có hai chiều vì nó có chiều cao, chiều rộng và chiều dài

examples: The agar cubes added a delightful chewiness to the tropical fruit salad.
She roasted the rutabaga cubes with olive oil and herbs.
I used a sugar cube to attract hummingbirds to my garden, placing it near their favorite flowers.
She made T-bone steak kebabs, threading cubes of marinated steak onto skewers with colorful vegetables.
My grandmother made strip steak kebabs, skewering marinated steak cubes with colorful bell peppers and onions.
words.defineEn: a figure, either hollow or solid, with six equally squared sides

examples: But the Earth is almost spheroid, or a slightly wonky sphere.
First made in 1569 by the Flemish cartographer Gerardus Mercator, this type of map basically turns the spheroid Earth into a cylinder.

And we’ve learned that the spheroid shape, rotation, revolution, and tilt of the Earth cause insolation, air temperature, pressure, and wind to form worldwide patterns that strongly depend on latitude.
Vesta is round…ish, what’s called an oblate spheroid, flattened a bit like a ball someone’s sitting on.
words.defineEn: (geometry) a solid shape obtained by half-rotating an ellipse around one of its axis

examples: Earth is a sphere.

words.defineEn: (geometry) a round object that every point on its surface has the same distance from its center

examples: But these cylinders represent proteins.

examples: These dense lumps of rock bump out from the ellipsoid and their mass gravitationally attracts oceans, while valleys in the ocean floor have less mass and the oceans flow away, shallower.
These aren't small changes, either - the level of the sea can vary by up to 100m from a uniform ellipsoid depending on the density of the Earth beneath it.

Well, water is held on Earth by gravity, so we could model the earth as a flattened & stretched spinning sphere and then calculate what height the oceans would settle to when pulled by gravity onto the surface of that ellipsoid.
words.defineEn: a surface whose plane sections are all ellipses or circles

examples: The left hemisphere controls the right side of our bodies, and vice versa.

All vertebrate brains consist of two hemispheres: the right and left.

examples: A rectangular pyramid is a polyhedron.
